results.title: A Trade for tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Eric Porter Productions
results.brief_description: Explains the typical training apprentices are given at HMAS Nirimba. Shows that the training in the navy can prepare them for outside jobs when they have finished their time.

results.title: A Track winding back
results.brief_description: Presents a sketch of life in Gundagai, NSW around the turn of the century utilising contemporary photographs and written records. Covers architecture, fashion, medicine, politics, problems of workers, the departure of troops for the Boer War and the celebration of Commonwealth Day.

results.title: A Town that died: Walhalla
results.creator_credit: Clifford Pleak and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Retraces the founding of the town of Walhalla after the discovery of gold. Illustrates the gold boom era, growth of the town and its eventual decline as the gold supply dimished.

results.title: A Town like Alice
results.creator_credit: Jack Lee, Joseph Janni and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Virginia McKenna and Peter Finch give towering performances in this moving story about a party of women compelled to trek through the Malayan jungle during World War II, because no Japanese officer will take responsibility for their care and feeding. Based on Nevil Shute’s best-selling novel, the film tells how the women come to terms with their hardships, and how they are befriended by a tough Australian prisoner of war who dreams of returning to his home town of Alice Springs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Lee, Joseph Janni and Rank Organisation Film Productions

results.title: A Touch of zen
results.creator_credit: King Hu, Hsia Liang-fang and Optimum Releasing
results.brief_description: Made long before “Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon” this wonderful martial arts epic will linger with you both for its atmospheric and mystical images and its lyrical and mysterious storyline. Set during the time of the Ming Dynasty in a rural village outside Peking, the story begins with the artist Ku Shen-chai who lives with his mother in a supposedly haunted, run-down fort. The arrival of a stranger, Ou-Yang Yin, to the village stirs the curiosity within Ku only to be further flamed by the sudden appearance of a beautiful woman named Yang Hui-Ching. Plot and sub-plot are interwoven to form an intricate tale binding the three protagonists in a web of intrigue and mystery. This is not a full-on action-packed martial arts film but the scenes of combat are impressively creative and beautifully performed. Cast includes Hsu Feng, Tien Peng, Hsueh Han, Shih Chun, Pai Ying. Photography by Hua Hui-ying.

results.title: A Touch of the terminals
results.creator_credit: Philip Bull and Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch
results.brief_description: Its the machine age, computers are taking over - reducing the workforce and increasing productivity. The unemployed can’t afford to buy the products produced and therefore the company can’t sell its products and is losing money. To make money they cull more workers, bring in more machines and again more unemployed who can’t afford to buy. A satirical look at the effects of computers. Cast includes Martin Vaughan, Michael Ross, Ray Anderson, Tony Llewellyn-Jones.

results.title: A Touch of hands (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James T. Crawford and University of Pittsburgh
results.brief_description: Documentary on expressive arts therapist, Ed Lilley’s work with a group of emotionally handicapped children as they prepare a puppet show. The children are shown playing group games, preparing the puppets and set, rehearsing and finally performing their show. The aim of this therapy is to allow the children to extend themselves and improve their self images

results.title: A Time together
results.brief_description: An adolescent boy wants his father to teach him canoeing with his newly-bought canoe, but he is too busy. When he reluctantly agrees and takes the canoe out with his son, they sense a deeper, more meaningful relationship during their time together.

results.title: A Time to look forward
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dunkley, Gerard Holdsworth and Post Office Telecommunications
results.brief_description: Four case histories show the activities that can be taken up in retirement - part-time job, moving to the country, gardening or hobbies - and also the problems encountered in retirement.
